notes: I have knowledge of several tool lending libraries and 'library of things' programs from my training data, but without web search access I cannot verify current statistics, outcomes, or cite specific academic studies. The programs listed (Berkeley, Sacramento, Toronto, London Library of Things) are real and well-documented, but I cannot provide up-to-date numbers or recent research findings. The pattern concept has strong real-world precedent - tool libraries have existed since the 1970s and the 'library of things' model has expanded significantly in the 2010s-2020s. I recommend re-running this research with web search enabled to get verified statistics and academic citations.
